title: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection
description: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection. It shouldn't do this. A typical user of a combobox would be very surprised to have the dialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected.
OB: If you drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry using the mouse, the CCombo fires a defaultSelection. However, standard Combos won't do this. As a result, it is impossible to differentiate between selecting an entry using the mouse and hitting enter from the text field of the CCombo.
EB: When a user selects an entry from the CCombo list using the mouse, the CCombo should not fire a defaultSelection event. This behavior should be consistent with that of standard Combos.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the CCombo dropdown list using the mouse.
2. Select an entry from the list using the mouse.
3. Observe if the CCombo fires a defaultSelection event.
